lead_paragraph: MOCHE--Leonard Harvey, 83, died, March 4 in Montefiore Hospital after a brief illness. He graduated from Bronx High School of Science, Columbia University (where he was captain of the debating team) and Harvard Law School. He became a litigator, working for firms until 1982, when he opened a private practice. His first marriage was to Hanneli Hall, mother of James and Mark. After her death, he married Dinah Levine. They divorced, and he married Mary Anne Gavagan, from whom he was later divorced. He was a loving father, stepfather, grandfather to Raphaela, and mentor to young lawyers. He loved the Brooklyn Dodgers, opera, dogs, European travel and book discussions. His final years were spent in the Hebrew Home at Riverdale, where he organized the daily minyan. His optimism is fondly remembered. 1/3
